<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Instantiating ThreadSanitizer inserts the tsan runtime library API function</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ensures the &#95;&#95;tsan&#95;init function is in the list of global constructors for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the module.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-threadsanitizer-cpp-/threadsanitizer"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-threadsanitizer-cpp-/threadsanitizer/#a6ea2c96858c1b7f09b578dbb8761fae9">ThreadSanitizer</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Instrumenting some of the accesses may be proven redundant.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Currently handled:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - read-before-write (within same BB, no calls between)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - not captured variables</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We do not handle some of the patterns that should not survive</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// after the classic compiler optimizations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// E.g. two reads from the same temp should be eliminated by CSE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// two writes should be eliminated by DSE, etc.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#39;Local&#39; is a vector of insns within the same BB (no calls between).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#39;All&#39; is a vector of insns that will be instrumented.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="661"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="662"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663" lineLink="#a538f6329dbaa96027ddf042d40cdef5f"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantint">ConstantInt</a> &#42;<a href="#a538f6329dbaa96027ddf042d40cdef5f">createOrdering</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder&lt;&gt;</a> &#42;IRB, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7">AtomicOrdering</a> ord) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint32&#95;t v = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="665"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">switch</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (ord) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="666"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7a56a57d29a3f9dda8671b4d6490a94b08">AtomicOrdering::NotAtomic</a>:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="667"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h/#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;unexpected atomic ordering!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00669" /><CodeLine lineNumber="669"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7a14194d0b2e6c6680067975517cd58eac">AtomicOrdering::Monotonic</a>:              v = 0; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="670"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Not specified yet:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="671"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// case AtomicOrdering::Consume:                v = 1; break;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="672"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7a993ca650a85e8e69b8f7eaa4809c4862">AtomicOrdering::Acquire</a>:                v = 2; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00673" /><CodeLine lineNumber="673"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7ab8e7b465df7c5979dc731d06e84ce2cf">AtomicOrdering::Release</a>:                v = 3; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7a960fbd067612ca87e16d5dfdb12fe40a">AtomicOrdering::AcquireRelease</a>:         v = 4; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00675" /><CodeLine lineNumber="675"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9bccbe67aaab722783ca4e7c504aaaa7ae3b0fa849dbd758b450f98fcfde936a2">AtomicOrdering::SequentiallyConsistent</a>: v = 5; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00677" /><CodeLine lineNumber="677"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IRB-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a8246a9e9405ffe2a9d8d020a949c8e96">getInt32</a>(v);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="678"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If a memset intrinsic gets inlined by the code gen, we will miss races on it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="681"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// So, we either need to ensure the intrinsic is not inlined, or instrument it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="682"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We do not instrument memset/memmove/memcpy intrinsics (too complicated),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00683" /><CodeLine lineNumber="683"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instead we simply replace them with regular function calls, which are then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="684"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// intercepted by the run-time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="685"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Since tsan is running after everyone else, the calls should not be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// replaced back with intrinsics. If that becomes wrong at some point,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="687"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we will need to call e.g. &#95;&#95;tsan&#95;memset to avoid the intrinsics.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Both llvm and ThreadSanitizer atomic operations are based on C++11/C1x</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// standards.  For background see C++11 standard.  A slightly older, publicly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// available draft of the standard (not entirely up-to-date, but close enough</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for casual browsing) is available here:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2011/n3242.pdf</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The following page contains more background information:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// http://www.hpl.hp.com/personal/Hans&#95;Boehm/c++mm/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"></CodeLine>
